text:
A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let me á
go to your English lecture.

I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something á
that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to á
tease me.

A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't á
the slightest grounds for it.

We lived with 3 persons in the loft of a house. It often occurred á
that other persons again and again climbed the stairs with much á
noise. When I was studying I couldn't concentrate and got angry.
Insulted by disgusting people.

My class leader told me I am not chosen for your English á
lectures.

Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and á
very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The á
heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very á
angry.

Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be á
blamed. I left them without supervision.

My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.  á
She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things á
as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.
People not cueing in the dining hall.

I felt anger against a person who told bad things about me in my á
absence.

My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them á
in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I á
couldn't play them again.

On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's á
car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was á
forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The á
other car drove off without even seeing what had happe

My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was not á
guilty. He was misled by his wife.

When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and á
she was fed up with my behaviour.
Insulted by some stupid people.

I was most angry when India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy á
held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my á
friend.

When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he á
made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.

I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could á
not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the á
University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it á
finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at hom

I feel anger when I see a "parent" beating and punishing his child á
in the street. Recently I was a withness of a similar case.

They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that á
the one I had was out of date.

When my neighbours accused my brother of stealing their á
rose-bush, I was very angry as he had not touched it at all.

Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I found á
roaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I á
called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came á
over and checked.
As a child, when I saw an "unesthetic" sight.

I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the á
scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at á
times just plain rude behavior.
Someone ruining someone's property just for the fun of it.

I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of my á
jr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolwork á
and who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older and á
more successful than they were. At the time I pictured so
When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.
I saw a friend's husband with another woman.

I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about á
"Hainburg". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the union á
speak about the situation.

I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable á
of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in á
the tram.

I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in á
which the children were involved as accusers of one of the á
parents.

After learning on the news about this man who killed more than á
300 women and habitually copulated into their inert bodies.

When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog. á
I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my á
sole.

A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a á
shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat, á
then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous á
from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the

I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the á
elementary human norms.

One of my good friends told people something I had told her á
in confidence about someone else.

[ I feel disgust at people lying.  It means that they say one á
thing to one person and the same thing in another way to another á
person and this makes people quarrel among themselves.]

I work part-time as a shop-assistant and a customer spoke to me á
very loudly about an Indian man & white woman with children - how á
horrible that was and would I want to have little dark children.

When I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the á
woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have á
respect for anyone.

When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to á
others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few á
notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his á
grovelling and the manner in which he had treated others.
I saw in the street a man spitting.

When my best friend started getting involved in my private á
affairs.

I felt disgusted when I found out that someone had betrayed me. á
That person had been dishonest with me and I felt used.

I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into á
the woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escaped á
from the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I was á
afraid.

A close relative of mine died in a serious car accident.  I was á
one of the first two people to see the corpse and I had to do it. á
 Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time á
that I was seeing a corpse.
Continous fear of a nuclear war.

When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing, á
that I had tuberculosis.

One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something á
inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed á
at night.

I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do.  I did á
something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though á
he promised not to report me, I am still frightened.
Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.

When I slept for the first time all alone in the house where I á
live now. A man phoned me at 2.00 am. He wanted something from á
me. I was afraid.

While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of á
cows.

When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I á
would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards á
me.

The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his á
permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.

Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too much á
people in it. This gives me a fearful experience.

My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the á
agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an á
accident.

When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and á
respiration).

I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed á
my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the á
second reel ended.

I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed á
one night by myself in the house.

Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the á
house and came back very late.
A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.

I was walking in the wood at night with my boyfriend. Very á
romantic. Suddenly I heard a car driving very slowly with the á
lights out, it looked as if they were looking for something.

Once late at night (around midnight) a person asked me to give á
him a lift. He suddenly tried to attack me but I could escape. á
After this he followed me for a little while.

I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad á
would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started á
getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very, á
very far away.
A shadow of guilt darkened his eyes.
He came to help her, to appease his guilt once and for all.
She wasn't about to live with the guilt of hurting yet a third person she cared about.

When I don't go to my parents on Sunday and phone them to tell á
them that I have to study. The truth is that I listened to sports á
on the radio.

When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to á
Catholicism but then once received - o.k.
Talking about someone behind their back.

When I have to take exams I am very excited and have not much á
time for the housekeeping. Then my friend has to do everything.

When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards á
my students.

I promised my mother to come home on her birthday, but at last I á
was prevented. Nevertheless it would have been possible to go but á
I did not.

A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's á
grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the á
reason for her action.

Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had á
given her no attention.
When I had a little accident with my boss'car.

I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from his á
invalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like being á
paralysed.

Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad she á
was.

When I have sometimes been unfair to my parents, when I have á
happened to deceive them over some trifling things.

A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator á
entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the á
fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the á
smoke in that direction.

I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I á
felt guilty before her.

I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother á
always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting á
my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I á
just behaved aggressively towards my sister.
Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.

I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days á
later he died.

When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents á
were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

I wasn't able to see my girlfriend on her birthday and because I á
was late arriving home from uni, I didn't phone her as arranged á
at a certain time (she rang in the meantime).

When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long á
separation.
When I got the first compound through column.

The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C á
junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.

Winning a tight tennis match. One set to play, and the team was á
behind by 3 games. We won the last set 6-2 and won the match by a á
game.

There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a á
Medical Assistant.

When I was at school, no one thought I could pass my MCE so at á
the end of the year my name was announced on the radio that I had á
passed. I was the happiest person.
When I met my mother after months of absence.
When I was admitted to the Chinese universiity.
When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at á
Kasungu town Hall.

This happened a year when I was having a hard time, I got á
admission to do research despite obstacles in the procedure of admission.
Passed an exam by 2 points.

I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at the á
Chinese university of H.K.  It was 7 o'clock in the morning.  á
Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea with á
them very joyfully.
When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.

I watched a football match with my old friend.  The performance á
of the team was very good and the team members were full of á
spirit.  The match was excellent and every time a goal was scored á
I felt excited.

For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father. á
Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very á
glad about it. It was a fine evening.
When I told my girlfriend a joke openly and frankly.

Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends á
whom I had known before I moved to a new district five years á
previously.

When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the á
rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.
Family member survived an operation.
When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.

Several good friends made me a surprise visit and this made me á
happy.  They are my closest friends and we had not seen each á
other for a long time.

When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4 á
weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I á
had a job there.

When my friend did not pass the high school graduation á
examinations.
When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.
Railway station good-bye.
[ No response.]

When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to á
read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.

I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right was á
mine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that people á
don't give you the right to have.
My father suddenly fell ill and died.

Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for á
ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself when á
playing in the garden.
When my grandmother died.

During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit á
suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she á
looked miserable.
My father gave money to my brother but not to me.
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.

When my friends did not ask me to go to a New Year's party á
with them.

A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before, á
did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half á
a year later.
When my girlfriend left me.

Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for á
the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas á
Years ago.

The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to á
each other.
Getting to know that my uncle in America had a brain tumor.

I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems á
and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by á
the irreversibility of the decision.

I had a girlfriend in the same class I was. I did not do well in á
my Exams, but she did satisfactorily well and was taken into á
another class leaving me behind.

A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the á
goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally á
forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.
China cannot give your lectures bigger place and sound system.

When I had not done well in Geography at my MCE I was expected to á
get more than I did.

I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told á
the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This á
was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

I had something wrong, saying wrong things and being impolite to á
someone, and this had embarrassed the this person.  And I á
still meet the person.
Teacher suspected me stealing money.
Not collecting homeworks in time to give the teacher.

When I realized that my bathing suit was spotted, I had became á
menstruated.

At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle  á
of a lesson.

When I saw my 18 year old son grab an oxygen mask as he had á
breathing difficulties.  I had a bad conscience because I had not á
stopped smoking.  Medication for the dilation of his breathing á
tubes also caused a sense of guilt in me.

During an informal discussion I contributed a lot even though I á
had not spent much time studying.  Whenever someone said that á
someone was not paying attention, or that he had too many other á
things to do, or that the persoon was not trying his best,
Swearing in public.

It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed á
Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because á
I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able á
to join the conversation.

Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I á
found that a collection of pornographic literature had been á
removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was á
aware of the existence of this material.

I was ashamed when my classmates discovered that I fell in love á
with an uneducated girl.
When relatives have acted strangely, and unfriendly towards me.
When I fell down.

My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship á
and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him á
nowadays.

I misunderstood a girl and thought that she loved me.  One day á
when I was talking to her, her boyfriend appeared and I felt á
ashamed.

My teacher asked me a question which I failed to answer and I was á
told to stay behind after the class and give the answer after á
studying it from a book.
I could not finish my homework on time.
i find myself in the odd position of feeling supportive of
i feel like a naughty school girl because i am falling behind
i were to go overseas or cross the border then i become a foreigner and will feel that way but never in my beloved land
i want each of you to feel my gentle embrace
i love neglecting this blog but sometimes i feel for my faithful readers
i feel is he generous
i feel very mislead by someone that i really really thought i knew and liked very much so
im feeling generous today heres one more you may have already seen but is good for a chuckle
i feel that i need to know that i can depend on myself before i put myself in the position of supporting someone else and being supported by someone else
i try my best to love on them shed some light but i feel deeply compassionate with their problems and hurt even if its someone in the media
im feeling and if ive liked being pregnant
i then feel your tender touch as you enfold me with his love
i lost a few people which i hate because i have a really hard time letting go of people to whom i feel loyal
i feel i m being nutritionally supportive of it as well
i feel blessed to know this family
i feel more gentle that way wth
i got home feeling hot tired and great

i wish to know whether i should feel sympathetic towards the airline american if say their plane is on fire or their pilot has exploded or whether i should want to set them on fire if say they just decided to walk on their obligations to save money
i smiled at him feeling his longing and said maybe later buddy but i have to make lunch now
i have a feeling this is a bit naughty scanning an article from a magazine but i know that so many people would love to read thi
i feel blessed beyond blessed to share my life with you each week
i feel so blessed and honored that we get to be its parents
No one .
What would you reckon the taxing increases ?
Alecia .
I know .
Are they ?
Sure .
What brand ?
Maybe .
Go ahead .
Did you enjoy making the movie ? We heard stories of disagreement with other actors and with the director .
No . The teacher is dragging the chalk over the blackboard . It set my teeth on edge .
Yes .
How come ?
You look like a cooking show host--only messier .
Why ?
No . Why ?
why not ?
Could I see the manager please ? I have a complaint to make .

There will be a parade to celebrate National Day this weekend .
All right .
